data.title: First female Afghan air force pilot asks US for asylum -- Capt. Rahmani said it's no longer safe for her to live in Afghanistan. Her attorney, Kimberly Motley, said her client has received numerous threats from insurgents and condemnation from government officials
'We remain unfazed' by the vote: Israel says it will continue building settlements in defiance of UN resolution
Netanyahu to be investigated for bribery, fraud
Kim Jong Un bans Christmas, orders North Koreans to celebrate his grandmother instead.
Former Argentina president Cristina Fernandez charged with corruption; $880m assets frozen
Nigerian suicide bomber 'lynched by mob' after explosive vest fails to detonate
Russian children send 45 tons of New Year’s presents to Syrian kids
Gunmen kidnap Iraqi female journalist who has campaigned against widespread corruption in the country.
A French sailor just circled the globe solo in 49 days, breaking the previous record by over 8 days.
Russia calls U.S. move to supply Syria rebels weapons a hostile act: RIA

Japan ministry to make it easier to shame companies with excessive overtime - Responding to the suicide of a worker at the Dentsu advertising on Christmas last year, the labor ministry will bolster regulations covering illegal overtime by making it easier to publicize the names of errant companies.
Hamas blasts Jews and Muslims dancing together at Hanukkah party in Bahrain, calls it a “disgraceful spectacle”
Philippine drug war nets 1 million people who have surrendered, been arrested or killed

UK psychologists slam study saying poverty does not make people unhappy: Labour peer slammed over happiness study that says poverty not as important as failed relationships Research by LSE economist accused of "letting austerity off the hook"
Japan’s Abe offers ‘everlasting condolences’ at Pearl Harbor
